item.title: Get Creative
item.dc:creator: feinifuh
item.content:encoded:
Staying creative is so important even if you are busy or not feeling good. I always feel like it keeps the child in you alive. Creativity gives me new energy and inspiration in life, therefore I love to do small creative projects in my free time. Even if they sound silly to some, my new idea is to make my own natural anti-mosquito candle. I recently wanted to buy some, but the natural ones are really expensive, so I googled and found out it's super easy to make candles yourself. I found an online shop selling all the supplies I need for natural candles and today I bought some organic essential Citronella oil for the anti-mosquito scent.

item.title: Collecting Rocks
item.dc:creator: feinifuh
item.content:encoded: I always collect rocks. This rocks are from the actual Lake Hwea in the South Island of New Zealand. The lake is in the mountains and it was windy and pretty cold when we visited, despite it being summer. The water of the lake is crystal clear and ice blue and big waves (for a lake) came ashore. The beach at the lake is covered with these beautiful clean, small rocks. It's so clear and peaceful up in the mountains, it really is a magical place. Donec sollicitudin molestie malesuada. item.title: Picking Fresh Flowers from the Garden
item.dc:creator: feinifuh
item.content:encoded:
Since we have a small garden I love to pick wild flowers and make little simple flower arrangements. It's such a simple thing, but it looks so nice and gives your living area a nice personal touch. So much cheaper and cuter than flowers from the store, I love it. Of course the flowers won't last so long, but this totally doesn't matter to me. Since I can pick new ones any time.

item.dc:creator: feinifuh
item.content:encoded: You can get totally creative with this white/grey little plant pot. Grow your own cactus or plant in this little hand-made ceramic pot. The pot is made in New Zealand by a local artist and every pot has a unique texture and style.

item.title: Blurry View
item.dc:creator: feinifuh
item.content:encoded:
The colors of nature and especially the ocean always fascinate me. I love the colors of the ocean! In this shot it was almost evening and we took a stroll at the beach before dinner during our holidays. I just took my iPhone and snapped a picture waving at the beach really quickly so that the picture would be blurry. I really love the outcome and I didn't even need to filter the image at all.
